inlineContent.text: singleton handles key presses, mouse buttons and movement, gamepads, and input actions. Actions and their events can be set in the
’s methods reflect the global input state and are not affected by
, as those methods only deal with the way input is propagated in the
This object emits the following signals:

abstract.text: A singleton for handling inputs.
Controls the mouse mode. See
for more information.
Returns the name of the joypad at the specified device index, e.g.
. Godot uses the
SDL2 game controller database
to determine gamepad names.
Returns
if any action, key, joypad button, or mouse button is being pressed. This will also return
if any action is simulated via code by calling
Returns the last mouse velocity. To provide a precise and jitter-free velocity, mouse velocity is only calculated every 0.1s. Therefore, mouse velocity will lag mouse movements.
Signal support.
Sets the value of the magnetic field of the magnetometer sensor. Can be used for debugging on devices without a hardware sensor, for example in an editor on a PC.
Returns the gravity in m/s² of the device’s accelerometer sensor, if the device has one. Otherwise, the method returns
Queries whether an input device should be ignored or not. Devices can be ignored by setting the environment variable
. Read the
SDL documentation
for more information.
Base class for all other classes in the engine.
Sets the default cursor shape to be used in the viewport instead of .cursorArrow.
Stops the input from propagating further down the
Returns the magnetic field strength in micro-Tesla for all axes of the device’s magnetometer sensor, if the device has one. Otherwise, the method returns
Framework to write Godot Game Extensions using the Swift Programming Language.

. The input event propagates up through the node tree until a node consumes it.
Types that conform to VariantStorable can be stored in a Variant and can be extracted
back out of a Variant.
A built-in data structure that holds a sequence of elements.
Returns
if you are pressing the Latin key in the current keyboard layout. You can pass a
constant.
Types that conform to VariantRepresentable can be stored directly in
with no conversion.  These include all of the Variant types from Godot (for
example
), Godot objects (those that subclass
SwiftGodot.Object) as well as the built-in Swift types UInt8, Int64 and Double.
Called when there is an input event. The input event propagates up through the node tree until a node consumes it.
Returns
if you are pressing the key in the physical location on the 101/102-key US QWERTY keyboard. You can pass a
constant.
Returns the last mouse velocity in screen coordinates. To provide a precise and jitter-free velocity, mouse velocity is only calculated every 0.1s. Therefore, mouse velocity will lag mouse movements.
Returns mouse buttons as a bitmask. If multiple mouse buttons are pressed at the same time, the bits are added together. Equivalent to
Returns the rotation rate in rad/s around a device’s X, Y, and Z axes of the gyroscope sensor, if the device has one. Otherwise, the method returns
Emitted when a joypad device has been connected or disconnected.
Returns the current value of the joypad axis at given index (see
Returns the duration of the current vibration effect in seconds.
Vibrate the handheld device for the specified duration in milliseconds.
Returns a value between 0 and 1 representing the raw intensity of the given action, ignoring the action’s deadzone. In most cases, you should use
instead.
Starts to vibrate the joypad. Joypads usually come with two rumble motors, a strong and a weak one.
is the strength of the weak motor (between 0 and 1) and
is the strength of the strong motor (between 0 and 1).
is the duration of the effect in seconds (a duration of 0 will try to play the vibration indefinitely). The vibration can be stopped early by calling
Gets an input vector by specifying four actions for the positive and negative X and Y axes.
If

, similar input events sent by the operating system are accumulated. When input accumulation is enabled, all input events generated during a frame will be merged and emitted when the frame is done rendering. Therefore, this limits the number of input method calls per second to the rendering FPS.
Sets a custom mouse cursor image, which is only visible inside the game window. The hotspot can also be specified. Passing
to the image parameter resets to the system cursor. See
for the list of shapes.
Returns
if you are pressing the mouse button specified with
If
, sends touch input events when clicking or dragging the mouse. See also
Sets the value of the rotation rate of the gyroscope sensor. Can be used for debugging on devices without a hardware sensor, for example in an editor on a PC.
Returns
when the user
pressing the action event in the current frame or physics tick. It will only return
on the frame or tick that the user releases the button.
Sends all input events which are in the current buffer to the game loop. These events may have been buffered as a result of accumulated input (
) or agile input flushing (
Sets the acceleration value of the accelerometer sensor. Can be used for debugging on devices without a hardware sensor, for example in an editor on a PC.

Returns a value between 0 and 1 representing the intensity of the given action. In a joypad, for example, the further away the axis (analog sticks or L2, R2 triggers) is from the dead zone, the closer the value will be to 1. If the action is mapped to a control that has no axis such as the keyboard, the value returned will be 0 or 1.
This will simulate pressing the specified action.
An input event type for actions.
Abstract base class for input events.
Returns the acceleration in m/s² of the device’s accelerometer sensor, if the device has one. Otherwise, the method returns
Marks an input event as handled. Once you accept an input event, it stops propagating, even to nodes listening to
or
Manages the game loop via a hierarchy of nodes.
Sets the gravity value of the accelerometer sensor. Can be used for debugging on devices without a hardware sensor, for example in an editor on a PC.
Stops the vibration of the joypad started with
Returns a dictionary with extra platform-specific information about the device, e.g. the raw gamepad name from the OS or the Steam Input index.
If the specified action is already pressed, this will release it.

printed on it. You can pass a

Sets the mouse position to the specified vector, provided in pixels and relative to an origin at the upper left corner of the currently focused Window Manager game window.
Get axis input by specifying two actions, one negative and one positive.
Returns an SDL2-compatible device GUID on platforms that use gamepad remapping, e.g.
. Returns
otherwise. Godot uses the
SDL2 game controller database
to determine gamepad names and mappings based on this GUID.
Adds a new mapping entry (in SDL2 format) to the mapping database. Optionally update already connected devices.
Removes all mappings from the internal database that match the given GUID.
Returns an
containing the device IDs of all currently connected joypads.

s.

if the system knows the specified device. This means that it sets all button and axis indices. Unknown joypads are not expected to match these constants, but you can still retrieve events from them.

when the user has
pressing the action event in the current frame or physics tick. It will only return

Returns the strength of the joypad vibration: x is the strength of the weak motor, and y is the strength of the strong motor.

if you are pressing the action event.
